Description: Lower body sherd of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (almost completely worn) with two concentric added white bands; exterior: part of lotus flower.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, but dated later than those chalices because she considers the style of the drawing to be debased and because of the elementary and isolated interior decoration (Lemos 1991, 72-3).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 73, p. 251, no. 374)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0162) (phase 2)
